                            java.lang.String title)
        Description copied from class: FindManager

        Specified by:
        showPromptDialog in class FindManager
        Parameters:
        model - the model containing the settings of the replace operation.
        title - the title of the dialog to show.

        the exit code of the dialog, as defined by the FindManager.PromptResult interface.

      • showFindDialog

        public void showFindDialog(FindModel model,
                           java.lang.Runnable okHandler)
        Description copied from class: FindManager
        Shows the Find, Replace or Find Usages dialog initializing it from the specified model and saves the settings entered by the user into the same model. Does not perform the actual find or replace operation.
        Specified by:
        showFindDialog in class FindManager
        Parameters:
        model - the model containing the settings of a find or replace operation.
        okHandler - Will be executed after doOkAction

      • findWasPerformed

        public boolean findWasPerformed()
        Description copied from class: FindManager
        Gets the flag indicating whether the "Find Next" and "Find Previous" actions are available to continue a previously started search operation. (The operations are available if at least one search was performed in the current IDE session.)
        Specified by:
        findWasPerformed in class FindManager
        Returns:
        true if the actions are available, false if there is no previous search operation to continue.

      • getFindNextModel

        public FindModel getFindNextModel(Editor editor)
        Description copied from class: FindManager
        Gets the model containing the search settings to use for "Find Next" and "Find Previous" operations specific for the editor given. It may be different than FindManager.getFindNextModel() if there is find bar currently shown for the editor.
        Specified by:
        getFindNextModel in class FindManager
        Parameters:
        editor - editor, for which find model shall be retreived for
        Returns:
        the model to use for the operations.

      • findString

        public FindResult findString(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                             int offset,
                             FindModel model)
        Description copied from class: FindManager
        Searches for the specified substring in the specified character sequence, using the specified find settings. Supports case sensitive and insensitive searches, forward and backward searches, regular expression searches and searches for whole words.
        Specified by:
        findString in class FindManager
        Parameters:
        text - the text in which the search is performed.
        offset - the start offset for the search.
        model - the settings for the search, including the string to find.
        Returns:
        the result of the search.

      • findString

                             int offset,
                             FindModel model,
                             VirtualFile file)

        Specified by:
        findString in class FindManager
        Parameters:

      • showMalformedReplacementPrompt

        public int showMalformedReplacementPrompt(FindModel model,
                                          java.lang.String title,
                                          FindManager.MalformedReplacementStringException exception)
        Description copied from class: FindManager
        Shows a replace prompt dialog for the bad replace operation.
        Specified by:
        showMalformedReplacementPrompt in class FindManager
        Parameters:
        model - the model containing the settings of the replace operation.
        title - the title of the dialog to show.
        exception - exception from FindManager.getStringToReplace(String, FindModel, int, CharSequence)
        Returns:
        the exit code of the dialog, as defined by the FindManager.PromptResult interface. May be only FindManager.PromptResult.CANCEL or FindManager.PromptResult.SKIP for bad replace operation

      • getStringToReplace

        public java.lang.String getStringToReplace(java.lang.String foundString,
                                           FindModel model,
                                           int startOffset,
                                           java.lang.CharSequence documentText)
                                    throws FindManager.MalformedReplacementStringException
        Description copied from class: FindManager
        Gets the string to replace with, given the specified found string and find/replace settings. Supports case-preserving and regular expression replaces.
        Specified by:
        getStringToReplace in class FindManager
        Parameters:
        foundString - the found string.
        model - the search and replace settings, including the replace string.
        startOffset - offset in the source text at which the string was found (matters for regex searches)
        documentText - source text in which the string was found (matters for regex searches)
        Returns:
        the string to replace the specified found string.
        Throws:
        FindManager.MalformedReplacementStringException
